data.body:
Let's keep working with the same code as the previous question:

Your boss likes your program (phew), but he wants you to implement a RewardsCard class, which inherits from CreditCard. In this class, he would like for the interest to be lowered by 2% if the card holder has a credit score above 700. You propose the following class, where credit_card is a CreditCard object:


How would your boss most likely react to this implementation of his idea?

answerChoices.body: Your boss is happy because the code works as intended.
Your boss is disappointed because you reused the function name of "calculate_interest", which will not work, because you already have a method by that name in the super class.
Your boss is disappointed because the Reward Card's adjusted_interest_rate was never modified.
Both B and C are correct.
